intro: Notopleura parasiggersiana, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a round, fleshy berry that turns red when mature. The plant is valued for its edible fruits and has traditional uses in some African cultures.
